publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-519 Kate Maclean on behalf of the Equal Opportunities Committee: Draft Census (Scotland) Order 2000—That the Parliament (1) agrees that the Draft Census (Scotland) Order 2000, except to the extent that it is subject to approval by resolution of the Parliament, be not submitted to Her Majesty in Council, and (2) calls upon the Scottish Executive to (a) introduce a Bill to amend the Census Act 1920 to enable particulars to be required in respect of religion in the Census in Scotland, and (b) lay a revised draft Order which will include, within particulars to be stated in returns, a question on religion, including a breakdown of Christian denomination, a more detailed breakdown of the question on ethnic groups and a question on language spoken at home with a specific question on Scots language. Supported by: Shona Robison*
S1M-519 Draft Census (Scotland) Order 2000 (lodged on 9 February 2000) Mr John McAllion*, Mr Michael McMahon*
